subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
The current form likely derives from a {{Han compound|ls=psc|宀|糲|alt2=䊪|c1=s|c2=p|nocap=y}}, as attested in the Western Han period. {{zh-l|*宀}} is later replaced with {{zh-l|*穴}}, and {{zh-l|*萬}} corrupts into {{zh-l|*廿}} and {{zh-l|*禼}}. Based on the corrupted form, ''{{w|Shuowen}}'' erroneously interprets this character as a {{Han compound|ls=psc|穴|米|疾|alt3=廿|禼|c1=s|c2=s|c3=p|c4=p|t1=cave; hole|t2=rice|nocap=y}}. In the current form, {{zh-l|*廿}} is omitted and {{zh-l|*米}} is replaced with {{zh-l|*釆}}.

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# to [[steal]]
# [[thief]]
# to [[acquire]] [[illegitimately]]; to [[usurp]]
# [[secretly]]; [[stealthily]]
# {{lb|zh|literary|humble}} [[personally]]
#* {{zh-x|臣 竊 計，君 宮 中 積 珍 寶，狗 馬 實 外 廄，美人 充 下陳{zhèn}。|I '''took the liberty''' to make an assessment and saw that the palace of our lord was piled full of precious things and treasures, with dogs and horses filling the outside stable and beautiful women filling the front hall.|ref=Zhanguoce}}
